sentences.english: He had to singel-crop on his plot.
sentences.chinese: 在他那小塊土地上，他只能採用單一耕種法。

sentences.english: Much care must be exercised that rangeland does not in its turn become desert.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，現在正在耕種的大量土壤將需要變成牧場。

sentences.english: Effect of long-term fallow and cultivation on soil fertility in rice-based cropping system .
sentences.chinese: 水旱輪作地區土壤長期休閒與耕種的肥力效應。

sentences.english: GrandmaGrandpa still planted their garden every spring.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶和爺爺仍然每年春天都耕種花園。

sentences.english: The farmland was worked by three families.
Nobody is willing to cultivate this infertile land.
sentences.chinese: 這塊薄地沒有人願意耕種。

sentences.english: Elephants may not be used to plough cotton fields.
sentences.chinese: 大象不可用來爲棉花田耕種。

sentences.english: The earth brought forth all things necessary for man, without his labor in plowing or sowing.
sentences.chinese: 人們不用耕種，一切生活必需全可仰給於大地。

sentences.english: Sohel started cultivating their small piece of land.
sentences.chinese: Sohel開始耕種家中那小片土地。

sentences.english: No doubt much land that is now cultivated will need to become rangeland.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，現在正在耕種的大量土壤將需要變成牧場。

sentences.english: They farmed, irrigated , and reclaimed vast stretches of land.
sentences.chinese: 他們耕種，灌溉，並領回的廣袤的土地。

sentences.english: The ground here is stony and not good for farming.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的地面多石，不太適於合耕種。

sentences.english: Grandma and Grandpa still planted their garden every spring.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶和爺爺仍然每年春天都耕種花園。

sentences.english: This field of grass will be kept for grazing, the others will be ploughed for crops.
sentences.chinese: 這片草地留作牧場，其餘的將翻耕種莊稼。

sentences.english: To help with planting, the farmer taught his sow to sow.
sentences.chinese: 這個農民教他的大母豬播種以幫助耕種。

sentences.english: Real estate would have gobbled all the arable land.
sentences.chinese: 房地產會吞噬所有可耕種土地。

definition: to clear a wild area for cultivation/to put under the plow
to be on the move/to roam or wander/to circulate (of goods or capital)
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
